trips.name: Petra
trips.description: Petra is one of Jordan's most famous sites, known for its rock-cut architecture such as the Treasury and its impressive red sandstone formations.

trips.name: Wadi Rum
trips.description: Wadi Rum is known for its desert landscapes, sandstone mountains, and Bedouin camps, offering various adventure activities.

trips.name: Jerash
trips.description: Jerash is famous for its Roman ruins, amphitheaters, and colonnaded streets, making it a major site for those interested in ancient history.

trips.name: Dead Sea
trips.description: The Dead Sea is known for its extremely salty water and mineral-rich mud, attracting visitors who want to experience floating and wellness treatments.

trips.name: Aqaba
trips.description: Aqaba is located on the Red Sea and is known for its coral reefs, diving spots, water sports, and seaside resorts.

trips.name: Amman Citadel
trips.description: Amman Citadel features Roman, Byzantine, and Islamic ruins, including the Temple of Hercules and the Umayyad Palace.

trips.name: Roman Theater
trips.description: The Roman Theater in Amman is an ancient amphitheater that remains a cultural venue for various events.

trips.name: Mount Nebo
trips.description: Mount Nebo offers panoramic views of the Dead Sea and the Holy Land and is traditionally linked to the story of Prophet Moses.

trips.name: Madaba Map Church
trips.description: The Church of Saint George in Madaba is known for its Byzantine mosaic map of the Holy Land.

trips.name: Ajloun Castle
trips.description: Ajloun Castle is a 12th-century fortress built to protect the region and features Islamic military architecture.

trips.name: Dana Biosphere Reserve
trips.description: Dana Biosphere Reserve is known for its diverse wildlife, mountains, and hiking trails, making it ideal for eco-tourism.

trips.name: Umm Qais
trips.description: Umm Qais features Greco-Roman ruins overlooking the Sea of Galilee, including basalt theaters and ancient streets.

trips.name: Karak Castle
trips.description: Karak Castle is a large Crusader fortress known for its tunnels, strong defensive design, and hilltop location.

trips.name: Wadi Mujib
trips.description: Wadi Mujib is a canyon known for its river hikes, waterfalls, and adventure trails within the biosphere reserve.

trips.name: Mujib Dam
trips.description: Mujib Dam provides essential water storage and offers scenic views of surrounding mountains and farmland.

trips.description: Qasr Amra is a UNESCO Jordan heritage site and a major Jordan tourist attraction. Famous for its frescoes and desert castle architecture, it is a prime Jordan travel .

trips.name: Shaumari Wildlife Reserve
trips.description: Shaumari Wildlife Reserve is a Jordan travel destination and Jordan tourist attraction home to Arabian oryx, gazelles, and conservation projects, highlighting Jordan tourism.

trips.name: Azraq Wetland Reserve
trips.description: Azraq Wetland Reserve is a Jordan tourist attraction and Jordan travel destination oasis, with bird migration, wetlands, and natural springs contributing to Jordan tourism.

trips.description: King Abdullah Mosque is a Jordan historic site and Jordan tourist attraction.Construction of the mosque began on June 5, 1982, the first phase was completed in 1986, and the second (final) phase was completed in 1989. Known for its blue dome and Islamic architecture, it is a Jordan travel destination in Jordan tourism.

trips.name: Rainbow Street
trips.description: Rainbow Street is a Jordan travel destination and popular . Featuring cafes, shops, and cultural sites, it is a vibrant Jordan tourism experience.

trips.name: Boulevard Abdali
trips.description: Boulevard Abdali is a modern Jordan travel destination and Jordan tourist attraction. Known for restaurants, shopping, and events, it enhances Jordan tourism in Amman.

trips.name: King Hussein Park
trips.description: King Hussein Park is a Jordan travel destination and Jordan tourist attraction with green areas, museums, and family attractions, contributing to Jordan tourism.

trips.name: Jordan Museum
trips.description: The Jordan Museum is a Jordan historic site and Jordan tourist attraction housing artifacts from prehistoric to Islamic eras. It is a must-see Jordan travel destination for Jordan tourism.

trips.name: Salt Archaeological Museum
trips.description: Salt Archaeological Museum is a Jordan historic site and Jordan tourist attraction. It showcases artifacts, old maps, and history, making it a key Jordan travel .

trips.name: Umayyad Palace
trips.description: Umayyad Palace is a Jordan historic site and Jordan tourist attraction with domes, courtyards, and Islamic architecture, making it a notable Jordan travel .

trips.name: Shobak Castle
trips.description: Shobak Castle is a Jordan historic site and Jordan tourist attraction built by Crusaders in the 12th century. It is a prime Jordan travel destination offering panoramic views and underground tunnels, .

trips.name: Al-Maghtas (Baptism Site)
trips.description: Al-Maghtas is a UNESCO Jordan heritage site and Jordan tourist attraction believed to be where Jesus was baptized. It is an important Jordan travel destination for religious Jordan tourism.
